DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective pilot intervention study examine efficacy exercise reduce symptom posttraumatic stress disorder ( PTSD ) psychiatric somatic symptom . The sample compose veteran age 18-65 combat-related PTSD ( N = 40 ) . Participants randomly assign one two group . Participants exercise train group ( n = 20 ) receive three 60-75 minute session per week combination aerobic resistance train eight week . In control stretch group , participant ( n = 20 ) receive train whole-body flexibility three time per week eight week . Secondary objective include 1 ) determine feasibility intervention ( measure percentage prescribe day exercise complete participant , percentage time exercise complete prescribed intensity duration ) ; 2 ) determine influence exercise training aerobic fitness strength sample ; 3 ) determine whether psychiatric/somatic symptom improvement associated improvement fitness strength . Finally , exploratory objective include examine whether exercise training improve early sign heart disease , whether certain biomarkers ( use MRI fMRI data inflammatory marker ) associate treatment response .
